column4: I have a quick question. What is the command to modify the groups a user is in ?
sweet. Thanks :). But I am somewhat not very keen on editing a file.. no command to do that?
linuxconf will do it... i think there is  packages
I think so... not sure... it used to come on RedHat 5.2 :P
atleast it is not called linuxconf directly. sudo apt-cache search --names-only linuxconf doesn't work.. it works on RedHat, then I am guessing it works on Fedora as well..
google it and see... i think it is source only most of the time... it really is easier to just edit the files
I will .. thanks ... and yes, it is easier to edit config files (and btw, I use vi :D )
matex: rpm doesn't register with the apt database...
heheh... and another question. What is the default, or somewhat safe default file permissions? 755 ?
thanks a lot ... I will look up linuxconf and get back .. have a great day :)
